1: -module(ct_telnet_own_server_SUITE).
    2: 
    3: -compile(export_all).
    4: 
    5: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    6: 
    7: %% telnet control characters
    8: -define(SE,	240).
    9: -define(NOP,	241).
   10: -define(DM,	242).
   11: -define(BRK,	243).
   12: -define(IP,	244).
   13: -define(AO,	245).
   14: -define(AYT,	246).
   15: -define(EC,	247).
   16: -define(EL,	248).
   17: -define(GA,	249).
   18: -define(SB,	250).
   19: -define(WILL,	251).
   20: -define(WONT,	252).
   21: -define(DO,	253).
   22: -define(DONT,	254).
   23: -define(IAC,	255).
   24: 
   25: -define(SHORT_TIME,2000).
   26: 
   27: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: %% TEST SERVER CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   29: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [
   33:      {require,telnet_server_conn1,{unix,[telnet]}},
   34:      {require,ct_conn_log},
   35:      {ct_hooks, [{cth_conn_log,[]}]}
   36:     ].
   37: 
   38: all() ->
   39:     [
   40:      expect,
   41:      expect_repeat,
   42:      expect_sequence,
   43:      expect_wait_until_prompt,
   44:      expect_error_prompt,
   45:      expect_error_timeout1,
   46:      expect_error_timeout2,
   47:      expect_error_timeout3,
   48:      total_timeout_less_than_idle,
   49:      no_prompt_check,
   50:      no_prompt_check_repeat,
   51:      no_prompt_check_sequence,
   52:      no_prompt_check_timeout,
   53:      ignore_prompt,
   54:      ignore_prompt_repeat,
   55:      ignore_prompt_sequence,
   56:      ignore_prompt_timeout,
   57:      large_string,
   58:      server_speaks,
   59:      server_disconnects,
   60:      newline_ayt,
   61:      newline_break,
   62:      newline_string
   63:     ].
   64: 
   65: groups() ->
   66:     [].
   67: 
   68: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   69:     ct:pal("Will use these log hook options: ~p",
   70: 	   [ct:get_config(ct_conn_log,[])]),
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   74:     ok.
   75: 
   76: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   80:     Config.
   81: 
   82: %% Simple expect
   83: expect(_) ->
   84:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
   85:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
   86:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, "ayt"),
   87:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
   88:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["ayt"]),
   89:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: %% Expect with repeat option
   93: expect_repeat(_) ->
   94:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
   95:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml xy xy"),
   96:     {ok,[["xy"],["xy"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xy"],[{repeat,2}]),
   97:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
   98:     ok.
   99: 
  100: %% Expect with sequence option
  101: expect_sequence(_) ->
  102:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  103:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml ab cd ef"),
  104:     {ok,[["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,
  105: 						   [["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]],
  106: 						   [sequence]),
  107:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: %% Check that expect can wait for delayed prompt
  111: expect_wait_until_prompt(_) ->
  112:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  113:     Timeouts = [{idle_timeout,5000},{total_timeout,7000}],
  114: 
  115:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_delayed_prompt 3000 xxx"),
  116:     {ok,["xxx"]} =
  117: 	ct_telnet:expect(Handle, "xxx",
  118: 			 [wait_for_prompt|Timeouts]),
  119:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_delayed_prompt 3000 yyy zzz"),
  120:     {ok,[["yyy"],["zzz"]]} =
  121: 	ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy","zzz"],
  122: 			 [{wait_for_prompt,"> "}|Timeouts]),
  123:     ok.
  124: 
  125: %% Check that expect returns when a prompt is found, even if pattern
  126: %% is not matched.
  127: expect_error_prompt(_) ->
  128:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  129:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx> yyy"),
  130:     {error,{prompt,"> "}} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"]),
  131:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  132:     ok.
  133: 
  134: %% Check that expect returns after idle timeout, and even if the
  135: %% expected pattern is received - as long as not newline or prompt is
  136: %% received it will not match.
  137: expect_error_timeout1(_) ->
  138:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  139:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"),
  140:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [{timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  141:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  142:     ok.
  143: 
  144: expect_error_timeout2(_) ->
  145:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  146:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"),
  147:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [{idle_timeout,1000},
  148: 							 {total_timeout,infinity}]),
  149:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  150:     ok.
  151: 
  152: %% Check that if server loops and pattern not matching, the operation
  153: %% can be aborted
  154: expect_error_timeout3(_) ->
  155:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  156:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_loop 5000 xxx"),
  157: 
  158:     T0 = now(),
  159:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"],
  160: 				       [{idle_timeout,infinity},
  161: 					{total_timeout,2001}]),
  162:     Diff = trunc(timer:now_diff(now(),T0)/1000),
  163:     {_,true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 2000) and (Diff =< 4000)},
  164: 
  165:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
  166:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["ayt"]),
  167:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  168:     ok.
  169:     
  170: %% OTP-12335: If total_timeout < idle_timeout, expect will never timeout
  171: %% until after idle_timeout, which is incorrect.
  172: total_timeout_less_than_idle(_) ->
  173:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  174:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"),
  175: 
  176:     T0 = now(),
  177:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"],
  178: 				       [{idle_timeout,5000},
  179: 					{total_timeout,2001}]),
  180:     Diff = trunc(timer:now_diff(now(),T0)/1000),
  181:     {_,true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 2000) and (Diff =< 4000)},
  182: 
  183:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
  184:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["ayt"]),
  185:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  186:     ok.
  187: 
  188: %% expect with ignore_prompt option should not return even if a prompt
  189: %% is found. The pattern after the prompt (here "> ") can be matched.
  190: ignore_prompt(_) ->
  191:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  192:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx> yyy"),
  193:     {ok,["yyy"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [ignore_prompt]),
  194:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  195:     ok.
  196: 
  197: %% expect with ignore_prompt and repeat options.
  198: ignore_prompt_repeat(_) ->
  199:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  200:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml yyy> yyy>"),
  201:     {ok,[["yyy"],["yyy"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"],
  202: 						   [{repeat,2},
  203: 						    ignore_prompt]),
  204:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  205:     ok.
  206: 
  207: %% expect with ignore_prompt and sequence options.
  208: ignore_prompt_sequence(_) ->
  209:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  210:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml xxx> yyy> zzz> "),
  211:     {ok,[["xxx"],["yyy"],["zzz"]]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,
  212: 						      [["xxx"],["yyy"],["zzz"]],
  213: 						      [sequence,
  214: 						       ignore_prompt]),
  215:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %% Check that expect returns after idle timeout when ignore_prompt
  219: %% option is used.
  220: %% As for expect without the ignore_prompt option, it a newline or a
  221: %% prompt is required in order for the pattern to match.
  222: ignore_prompt_timeout(_) ->
  223:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  224:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"),
  225:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [ignore_prompt,
  226: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  227:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"), % sends prompt and newline
  228:     {ok,["xxx"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [ignore_prompt,
  229: 						      {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  230:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx\n"), % no prompt, but newline
  231:     {ok,["xxx"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [ignore_prompt,
  232: 						      {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  233:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"), % no prompt, no newline
  234:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [ignore_prompt,
  235: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  236:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  237:     ok.
  238: 
  239: %% no_prompt_check option shall match pattern both when prompt is sent
  240: %% and when it is not.
  241: no_prompt_check(_) ->
  242:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  243:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"),
  244:     {ok,["xxx"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [no_prompt_check]),
  245:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt yyy"),
  246:     {ok,["yyy"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [no_prompt_check]),
  247:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  248:     ok.
  249: 
  250: %% no_prompt_check and repeat options
  251: no_prompt_check_repeat(_) ->
  252:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  253:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml xxx xxx"),
  254:     {ok,[["xxx"],["xxx"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,["xxx"],
  255: 						   [{repeat,2},
  256: 						    no_prompt_check]),
  257:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml_no_prompt yyy yyy"),
  258:     {ok,[["yyy"],["yyy"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,["yyy"],
  259: 						   [{repeat,2},
  260: 						    no_prompt_check]),
  261:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  262:     ok.
  263: 
  264: %% no_prompt_check and sequence options
  265: no_prompt_check_sequence(_) ->
  266:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  267:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml_no_prompt ab cd ef"),
  268:     {ok,[["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,
  269: 						   [["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]],
  270: 						   [sequence,
  271: 						    no_prompt_check]),
  272:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: %% Check that expect returns after idle timeout when no_prompt_check
  276: %% option is used.
  277: no_prompt_check_timeout(_) ->
  278:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  279:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"),
  280:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [no_prompt_check,
  281: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  282:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: %% Check that it's possible to receive multiple chunks of data sent from
  286: %% the server with one get_data call
  287: large_string(_) ->
  288:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  289:     String = "abcd efgh ijkl mnop qrst uvwx yz ",
  290:     BigString = lists:flatmap(fun(S) -> S end,
  291: 			      [String || _ <- lists:seq(1,10)]),
  292:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- BigString, C/=$ ],
  293: 
  294:     {ok,Data} = ct_telnet:cmd(Handle, "echo_sep "++BigString),
  295:     ct:log("[CMD] Received ~w chars: ~s", [length(lists:flatten(Data)),Data]),
  296:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- lists:flatten(Data), C/=$ , C/=$\r, C/=$\n, C/=$>],
  297: 
  298:     %% Test #1: With a long sleep value, all data gets gets buffered and
  299:     %% ct_telnet can receive it with one single request to ct_telnet_client.
  300:     %% Test #2: With a short sleep value, ct_telnet needs multiple calls to
  301:     %% ct_telnet_client to collect the data. This iterative operation should
  302:     %% yield the same result as the single request case.
  303: 
  304:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_sep "++BigString),
  305:     ct:sleep(1000),
  306:     {ok,Data1} = ct_telnet:get_data(Handle),
  307:     ct:log("[GET DATA #1] Received ~w chars: ~s",
  308: 	   [length(lists:flatten(Data1)),Data1]),
  309:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- lists:flatten(Data1), C/=$ , C/=$\r, C/=$\n, C/=$>],
  310: 
  311:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_sep "++BigString),
  312:     %% On some slow machines, 50 ms might not be enough to get the
  313:     %% first packet of data. We will therefore keep trying for a
  314:     %% second before we give up this...
  315:     F = fun RepeatUntilData(N) ->
  316: 		ct:sleep(50),
  317: 		case ct_telnet:get_data(Handle) of
  318: 		    {ok,[]} when N>1 ->
  319: 			RepeatUntilData(N-1);
  320: 		    Other ->
  321: 			Other
  322: 		end
  323: 	end,
  324:     {ok,Data2} = F(20),
  325:     ct:log("[GET DATA #2] Received ~w chars: ~s", [length(lists:flatten(Data2)),Data2]),
  326:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- lists:flatten(Data2), C/=$ , C/=$\r, C/=$\n, C/=$>],
  327: 
  328:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  329:     ok.
  330: 
  331: %% The server says things. Manually check that it gets printed correctly
  332: %% in the general IO log.
  333: %%
  334: %% In this test case we simulate data sent spontaneously from the
  335: %% server. We use ct_telnet_client:send_data instead of ct_telnet:send
  336: %% to avoid flushing of buffers in the client, and we use
  337: %% echo_no_prompt since the server would normally not send a prompt in
  338: %% this case.
  339: server_speaks(_) ->
  340:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  341: 
  342:     Backdoor = ct_gen_conn:get_conn_pid(Handle),
  343:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  344: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the first message"),
  345:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  346: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the second message"),
  347:     %% Let ct_telnet_client get an idle timeout. This should print the
  348:     %% two messages to the log. Note that the buffers are not flushed here!
  349:     ct:sleep(15000),
  350:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  351: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the third message"),
  352:     {ok,_} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["first.*second.*third"],
  353: 			      [no_prompt_check, sequence]),
  354:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["the"], [no_prompt_check,
  355: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  356:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  357: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the fourth message"),
  358:     %% give the server time to respond
  359:     ct:sleep(2000),
  360:     %% closing the connection should print last message in log
  361:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  362:     ok.  
  363: 
  364: %% Let the server close the connection. Make sure buffered data gets printed
  365: %% to the general IO log.
  366: server_disconnects(_) ->
  367:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  368:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "disconnect_after 1500"),
  369:     %% wait until the get_data operation (triggered by send/2) times out
  370:     %% before sending the msg
  371:     ct:sleep(500),
  372:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt This is the message"),
  373:     %% when the server closes the connection, the last message should be
  374:     %% printed in the log
  375:     ct:sleep(3000),
  376:     _ = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  377:     ok.
  378: 
  379: %% Test option {newline,false} to send telnet command sequence.
  380: newline_ayt(_) ->
  381:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  382:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, [?IAC,?AYT], [{newline,false}]),
  383:     {ok,["yes"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yes"]),
  384:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  385:     ok.
  386: 
  387: %% Test option {newline,false} to send telnet command sequence.
  388: newline_break(_) ->
  389:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  390:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, [?IAC,?BRK], [{newline,false}]),
  391:     %% '#' is the prompt in break mode
  392:     {ok,["# "]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["# "], [no_prompt_check]),
  393:     {ok,R} = ct_telnet:cmd(Handle, "q", [{newline,false}]),
  394:     "> " = lists:flatten(R),
  395:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  396:     ok.
  397: 
  398: %% Test option {newline,String} to specify an own newline, e.g. "\r\n"
  399: newline_string(_) ->
  400:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  401:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo hello-", [{newline,"own_nl\n"}]),
  402:     {ok,["hello-own_nl"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["hello-own_nl"]),
  403:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  404:     ok.
